hackathon-description-text: The hackGVSU event will help students learn more about HTML & REST API development.  Blackboard Learn, a web application very familiar to students, will be used as a target evnironment for new HTML modules or deep integration systems with REST API.
hackathon-eligibility: hackGVSU is open to any student, faculty, or staff member at GVSU, or any other institution or high school. Please note:
hackathon-requirements:
Category 1:
Build a module for Blackboard Learn Community Portal, which will make things easier for students or faculty, or which can be useful to their academic experience.
Category 2:
Use the REST API to build an integration or web application that will improve the experience of students and faculty who are using Blackboard Learn.

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1 N Campus Dr, Allendale, MI 49401, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Blackboard modules category can contain any of the browser-based, client-side technologies such as: HTML, JavaScript, CSS, Ajax, media dev, jQuery etc.  Requires a basic understanding of HTML and front-end web design.

Develop a server-side integration and a web application with Blackboard REST API.  Create a video of it for a review by the judges.  Winning projects will be asked to upload source code to github for others to use.

hackathon-location-address: 1 N Campus Dr, Allendale, MI 49401, USA
